bill.title: Relating To The Department Of Human Services.
bill.description: Establishes the all-claims, all-payer data center steering committee within the department of human services to oversee the all-claims, all-payer database and data center. (CD1)

history.action: Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to HHH, JHA, FIN, referral sheet 3
Bill scheduled to be heard by HHH on Tuesday, 02-09-21 9:30AM in House conference room 329 Via Videoconference.

The committees on HHH recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Tam, Gates, Har, Kapela, Nishimoto, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) LoPresti.
Reported from HHH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 233) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JHA.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JHA with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Eli, Gates, Hashimoto excused (3).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JHA on Tuesday, 02-16-21 2:00PM in House conference room 325 Via Videoconference.

The committees on JHA recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Nakashima, Matayoshi, Ichiyama, D. Kobayashi, LoPresti, Lowen, McKelvey, Nakamura, Todd, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Takumi, Tokioka.
Reported from JHA (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 569) as amended in HD 2, recommending referral to FIN.
Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Kong, Matayoshi excused (3).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Wednesday, 03-03-21 2:00PM in House conference room 308 Via Videoconference.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 15 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Branco, Eli, Holt, Ilagan, B. Kobayashi, Marten, Nishimoto, Perruso, Sayama, Tam, Wildberger, Yamashita, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and Excused: none.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 908), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Sayama excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 298).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPN, WAM.
Re-Referred to HMS, WAM.
The committee(s) on HMS has scheduled a public hearing on 03-23-21 3:10PM; CR 225 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on HMS recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in HMS were as follows: 4 Aye(s): Senator(s) San Buenaventura, Ihara, Acasio, Misalucha; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) Fevella.
Reported from HMS (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1155) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 04-07-21 9:45AM; CR 211 & Videoconference.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 11 Aye(s): Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Keith-Agaran, English, Inouye, Kanuha, Kidani, Moriwaki, Shimabukuro, Taniguchi, Wakai, Fevella; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 1664) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-13-21.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 0 (none). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 772) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 558).
House Conferees Appointed: Yamane, Nakashima, Tam Co-Chairs; Ward.
Senate Conferees Appointed: San Buenaventura Chair; English Co-Chair; Acasio.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 809).
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 560).
Bill scheduled for Conference Committee Meeting on Friday, 04-23-21 2:50PM in conference room CR 329.

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 4 Ayes: Representative(s) Yamane, Nakashima, Tam, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.

The Conference committee recommends that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes of the Senate Conference Managers were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) San Buenaventura, English, Acasio; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 157) as amended in (CD 1).
Forty-eight (48) hours notice Tuesday 04-27-21.
Reported from Conference Committee as amended CD 1 (Conf. Com. Rep. No. 157).
48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 04-27-21.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). Ayes, 25; Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 0 Excused: none.
Passed Final Reading as amended in CD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) LoPresti excused (1).
Received notice of Final Reading (Sen. Com. No. 858).
Received notice of passage on Final Reading in House (Hse. Com. No. 634).
Transmitted to Governor.
Notice of intent to veto (Gov. Msg. No. 1158)
Notice of Intent to veto dated 06/21/2021 (Gov. Msg. No. 1158)
Vetoed (Gov. Msg. No. 1290).
Vetoed on 07/06/2021 - Returned from the Governor without approval (Gov. Msg. No. 1290).
